alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 5:31PM EDT until August 12 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 531 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Souderton, or 21 miles south of Allentown, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Lansdale, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Souderton, Bedminster, Chalfont, Tinicum, Hatfield, New Hope, Dublin, Stockton, Green Lane, Washington Crossing, Fricks, Pipersville, Gardenville, Spring Mount, Richboro and Skippack. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 28 and 38. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
